Articles.Content:
I found the map view distracting since every orbit is always rendered, so here is my attempt to clean it up a bit. Only lightly tested.

Automatically hide distant orbits while zoomed in

Download the latest release from:

  • Github MIT License
  • SpaceDock

Installing

Extract and copy into your KSP2 install directory

Requires SpaceWarp 0.4.0+: Github or SpaceDock

Changelog

v0.4.0

  • Added the ability to hide the orbits of other ships in the map view, enabled by default
  • Added exit button to mod UI

Issues

  • Distant orbits are always hidden (can be displayed using the toggle in the mods UI menu)
Edited March 24, 2023 by Strykker2
Updated mod version

This is a great mod, but a nice feature to add to this would be hiding orbits of all vehicles but the active one. The map gets super cluttered with all of them showing needlessly. There was a mod for this in KSP1 called Too Many Orbits, but so far it's not been updated for KSP2. This would be a very handy QoL option.
I've created a new version that is able to do this now, should hide orbits of all other ships that aren't the active or your target.
